review_id:
The most beautiful Starbucks I've ever been to! There are a lot of people at noon, so may need to line up to get in,but you don't have to wait too long and it's totally worth it!

In addition to meals, they also sell T-shirt peripherals and coffee beans. There are huge machines placed in the center. You can see the coffee bean production process and hear the rustle of the beans passing through the pipes. They flow to the sales counter and become the coffee you want!

In addition to the coffee, I also highly praise the pastries! The grape cinnamon rolls have a crispy crust that will make you bite after bite. Before leaving Milan, I visited again!

review_id:
Unique coffee experience with some buts

First of all, be ready to wait 10-20 minutes in a queue outside unless it is 8 am or 9 pm. The inside is of course quite crowded as well.

Secondly, the endless waiting time doesn't finish at the door. For placing your order and getting it you will need to wait again (overall, might be up to 40 minutes in total. Ridiculous for such places that are not restaurants).

Finally, the drinks are indeed good (especially, if you opt for artisan ones). But again, the famous one with olive oil seems to be sold out all the time.
The food is okay - with an Italian twist but nothing special and overpriced.

This place can be a nice entertainment if you have time in Milan but not more.

- virtually no indoor seating

review_id: One of the most fashionable cafes in the city.  Immersed in a warm and reserved atmosphere, inside a courtyard of via Montenapoleone in the quadrilateral of world fashion, this location fascinates us for the mere fact of being there, to give us an environment where we can relax and meet people from all over the world.  We stopped for an aperitif with friends.  The location is really beautiful and alone does its show.  The service is friendly, knowledgeable and fast.  We chose three SPRITZ and they were done well, they also arrived accompanied by a plate per guest with a smoked salmon sandwich with cream of fresh cheese and poppy seeds, three baskets of bread, one with curry cream and dried tomatoes, one with cream cheese and sesame seeds, one with cream cheese with pumpkin seeds, and as a side dish beetroot slices with cream cheese and poppy seeds (at first glance I thought of bresaola, then approaching it I understood).  All very nice.  Price 54,00EUR ... almost low, if we think we are in the heart of world fashion and in one of the most expensive streets in the world.  I will definitely be back.  It was an enjoyable experience.

This cafe is located right next to the park. The ambience is all in pink and cute to click photos. However I think it was quite crowded for me to click some! The crockery is also so lovely!  They also had some coffee powder packets for selling purpose!

I tried their Cappuccino for 2.5 euros.

They don't provide sugar in their cafe. As someone coming from India, I am used to drink coffee with sugar. But they explained that they use the coffee beans grown by local farmers and to maintain the authenticity, they prefer brewing the coffee with its natural taste! To be honest, I would have loved sugar, but without that, it tasted par excellence too! I had it in the morning and I can still feel the taste and aroma as I recollect! Really a must try if you are in Milan. You surely would not regret it.

Kudos to the service staff! Excellent job and quite friendly people greeting with smiling faces! (And yes, they speak English!)

review_id:
De Fer... More like De Awesome!

De Fer Coffee in the Strip District is a step above mostly all other coffee shops I have ever been to based on the level of service, quality of the coffee, existence of wine & beer offerings, and the ambiance of the cafe.

The owners and managers hit home runs when hiring their staff.  Every employee was knowledgeable, friendly, enthusiastic, and genuine.  I regret not remembering employee names because they all deserve so much recognition for doing a great job.  I was at De Fer on Sunday, October 8th doing some work for about an hour around 4:00pm.  The Steelers had just beat the Ravens!

The drip coffee was some of the best I've ever had.  I purchased some whole beans that I can't wait to get into at home.  I did not partake in the wine & beer offerings.  However, it is pretty rare to find a coffee roaster that also has a liquor license for wine and beer sales.  I really want to visit Pittsburgh again just to check out more of De Fer's offerings.

The cafe is busy!  However, the staff do an unbelievable job ensuring a good experience by bringing drinks and food to the tables instead of the customary crowd of caffeine deprived customers standing around the drink bar eagerly awaiting for their name to be mispronounced.  It's just a cool space in a redeveloped industrial building with a lot of great neighborhoody things popping up around.

Way to go De Fer.
